library/nginx.description: Nginx is a high-performance web server and reverse proxy.
library/nginx.quick_start: Visit the URL; mount your site content to serve your app.

library/httpd.description: Apache HTTP Server is a robust, extensible web server.
library/httpd.quick_start: Visit the URL; mount /usr/local/apache2/htdocs/ with your content.

caddy.description: Caddy is an easy, production-ready web server with automatic HTTPS.
caddy.quick_start: Visit the URL; provide a Caddyfile for routing and TLS.

traefik.description: Traefik is a cloud-native edge router and reverse proxy.
traefik.quick_start: Expose it and declare routers/services; see dashboard with --api/dashboard.

jc21/nginx-proxy-manager.description: A web UI for managing Nginx reverse proxy hosts and SSL.
jc21/nginx-proxy-manager.quick_start: Open UI, login, add hosts and certificates.

grafana/grafana.description: Grafana is a visualization and analytics platform for metrics and logs.
grafana/grafana.quick_start: Open the URL, login with admin/admin on first run, add a data source, create a dashboard.

prom/prometheus.description: Prometheus collects and queries time-series metrics.
prom/prometheus.quick_start: Open /graph to run metric queries; /alerts shows alerting rules.

prom/alertmanager.description: Alertmanager handles alerts sent by Prometheus.
prom/alertmanager.quick_start: Expose it and configure routes/receivers via alertmanager.yml.

prom/node-exporter.description: Node Exporter exposes host hardware and OS metrics.
prom/node-exporter.quick_start: Run with host mounts or Docker metrics; scrape via Prometheus.

grafana/loki.description: Loki is a cost-effective, Prometheus-inspired log aggregation system.
grafana/loki.quick_start: Run Loki and promtail; configure Grafana to read from Loki.

grafana/promtail.quick_start: Run with a config file to scrape containers/paths and send to Loki.

grafana/tempo.description: Tempo is a distributed tracing backend.
grafana/tempo.quick_start: Run Tempo and configure tracing SDKs/collectors to push spans.

jaegertracing/all-in-one.description: Jaeger all-in-one (collector, query, UI) for distributed tracing demos.
jaegertracing/all-in-one.quick_start: Expose query UI and point clients/collectors at the collector endpoint.

rabbitmq.description: RabbitMQ is a lightweight message broker supporting AMQP and more.
rabbitmq.quick_start: Expose 15672 for the Management UI; create a queue and start publishing/consuming.

nats.description: NATS is a high-performance messaging system for cloud-native apps.
nats.quick_start: Expose 4222 for clients; 8222 serves a simple monitoring UI if enabled.

eclipse-mosquitto.description: Eclipse Mosquitto is a lightweight MQTT broker.

bitnami/kafka.description: Apache Kafka is a distributed event streaming platform.
bitnami/kafka.quick_start: Run Zookeeper or KRaft, expose listener ports, create topics and produce/consume.

bitnami/zookeeper.description: Zookeeper is a centralized service for maintaining configuration and naming.
bitnami/zookeeper.quick_start: Run alongside Kafka or other systems needing coordination.

library/postgres.description: PostgreSQL is a powerful open-source relational database.
library/postgres.quick_start: Expose if needed; connect via psql or a DB client; create DBs/users.

library/mysql.description: MySQL is a popular open-source relational database.
library/mysql.quick_start: Expose if needed; connect with the mysql client; create DBs/users.

library/mariadb.description: MariaDB is a community-developed fork of MySQL.
library/mariadb.quick_start: Expose if needed; connect with mysql-compatible tools.

library/redis.description: Redis is an in-memory data store used as a database, cache and message broker.
library/redis.quick_start: Expose 6379; set a password via REDIS_PASSWORD or command config if needed.

mongo.description: MongoDB is a document database for modern applications.
mongo.quick_start: Expose 27017; create users/DBs as required; consider volumes for data.

clickhouse/clickhouse-server.description: ClickHouse is a fast open-source column-oriented OLAP database.
clickhouse/clickhouse-server.quick_start: Expose 8123 (HTTP) and 9000 (native) as needed; create DBs and tables.

influxdb.description: InfluxDB is a time series database designed for metrics and events.
influxdb.quick_start: Expose 8086; create an org/bucket/token on first run.

dpage/pgadmin4.description: pgAdmin is a web-based administration tool for PostgreSQL.
dpage/pgadmin4.quick_start: Expose UI port; set default email/password via env; add servers to manage.

adminer.description: Adminer is a lightweight database management tool (single PHP file).
adminer.quick_start: Expose 8080 (or chosen); select DB driver and connect.

phpmyadmin.description: phpMyAdmin is a web interface for MySQL and MariaDB.
phpmyadmin.quick_start: Expose 80/8080; set PMA_HOST to your DB host; login with DB creds.

minio/minio.quick_start: Expose 9000 (S3) and 9001 (console); set access keys via env.

sonatype/nexus3.description: Nexus Repository Manager stores build artifacts and container images.
sonatype/nexus3.quick_start: Expose 8081; retrieve initial admin password from the data volume file.

sonarqube.description: SonarQube performs continuous code quality and security analysis.
sonarqube.quick_start: Expose 9000; login admin/admin on first run, then change password.

jenkins/jenkins.description: Jenkins is an automation server for CI/CD.
jenkins/jenkins.quick_start: Expose 8080; read the initial admin password from /var/jenkins_home/secrets/.

gitea/gitea.description: Gitea is a lightweight self-hosted Git service with a web UI.
gitea/gitea.quick_start: Expose 3000 (HTTP) and 22 (SSH) if needed; run setup wizard.

gitlab/gitlab-ce.description: GitLab CE is a full DevOps platform (git, CI/CD, registry, etc.).
gitlab/gitlab-ce.quick_start: Expose HTTP/SSH/registry ports; initial root password can be read from logs or file.

quay.io/keycloak/keycloak.description: Keycloak provides SSO and identity/access management.
quay.io/keycloak/keycloak.quick_start: Run in dev mode for quick start; open admin console, create realm/clients/users.

vaultwarden/server.description: Vaultwarden is a lightweight Bitwarden-compatible password manager server.
vaultwarden/server.quick_start: Expose the web UI; set admin token if enabling admin panel.

hashicorp/vault.description: HashiCorp Vault manages secrets, encryption, and identity-based access.
hashicorp/vault.quick_start: Run dev mode for demo; otherwise initialize and unseal before use.

getmeili/meilisearch.description: Meilisearch is a fast, relevance-focused search engine with a simple HTTP API.
getmeili/meilisearch.quick_start: Expose 7700; set MEILI_MASTER_KEY; create an index and add documents.

typesense/typesense.description: Typesense is an open-source, typo-tolerant search engine.
typesense/typesense.quick_start: Expose 8108; set TYPESENSE_API_KEY; create a collection and index documents.

opensearchproject/opensearch.description: OpenSearch is a community-driven, open-source search and analytics suite.
opensearchproject/opensearch.quick_start: Expose 9200/9600; set cluster settings and security as needed.

opensearchproject/opensearch-dashboards.description: OpenSearch Dashboards is the visualization UI for OpenSearch.
opensearchproject/opensearch-dashboards.quick_start: Expose 5601; point it at your OpenSearch cluster.

redis/redis-stack.description: Redis Stack bundles Redis with modules for search, JSON, and more.
redis/redis-stack.quick_start: Expose database and UI ports; connect with Redis clients or use the browser UI.

n8n/n8n.description: n8n is a workflow automation tool with a visual editor.
n8n/n8n.quick_start: Expose the web UI; create a user and start building workflows.

metabase/metabase.description: Metabase is a simple, open-source BI tool for dashboards and analytics.
metabase/metabase.quick_start: Expose 3000; complete setup wizard, connect a database, build dashboards.

bitnami/minio.description: Bitnami-packaged MinIO for S3-compatible object storage.
bitnami/minio.quick_start: Expose 9000/9001; set credentials via env; open console.

bitnami/wordpress.description: WordPress is a popular CMS; this container includes required services.
bitnami/wordpress.quick_start: Expose web port; follow setup; persistent volumes recommended.
